docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Making your first program
docs.text: This lesson will go over how to make your first program in Python which is one of the most popular, simple and widely used programming languages out there. This will teach basic concepts such as output, input, variables, loops and conditionels. This lesson will assume you have a working Python environment using Python (3.10.12) or later.

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
To print text into the conosle, use the print("function)

print("Hello World!")

This function will output Hello World! into the terminal. Text must be wrapped within quotes (This is called a string)

To print a number, you can do the same thing without the quote as numbers are not a string

print(9)
